description: From Middle English disclosen, from Middle French desclos, from Old French desclore, itself from Vulgar Latin disclaudere, from Latin dis- + claudere (“to close, shut”) or as a variant of discludo, discludere (cf. disclude). English equivalent dis- +‎ close.

verbs.description: disclose (third-person singular simple present discloses, present participle disclosing, simple past and past participle disclosed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To uncover, physically expose to view.
(transitive) To expose to the knowledge of others; to make known, state openly, reveal.
examples: Synonyms: reveal, unveil, divulge, publish, impart
